title: Viewfinder: Thompson Speedway Motorsports Park
text:
Michele McDonald for The Boston Globe
By Michele McDonald Globe correspondent September 05, 2015
The Thompson Speedway Motorsports Park in Thompson, Conn., opened in 1940 and hosted its first NASCAR race in 1951. It has a classic 5/8-mile oval and hosts races from one of the oldest and most loved regional touring series, the NASCAR Whelen Modified Tour. The World Series of Speedway Racing, featuring 15 divisions of competition, will be held there Oct. 16-18.
Michael Rivers (left), a mechanic, and Scott Michalski, a driver, get ready for an entry-level race, the Monster Mini, in the last of the summer series races.
